intro: Ackama papuana, commonly known as the Papuan ackama, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Guinea. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes trees and shrubs known for their aromatic properties. The plant features compound leaves with serrated edges and produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, contributing to its reproductive strategy. Ackama papuana is often found in tropical rainforests, where it thrives in moist, shaded environments.
